title: Roasted Tomato and Garlic Pasta
intro: My spin on a recipe inspired by Kenji Lopez-Alt's quick fresh tomato pasta. Roasting the tomatoes in the over adds additional with less mess.

context.note: The peel will prevent the garlic from burning
Most types of dried pasta will work, but be sure to use a pan that will fit your dried pasta of choice easily
Fish sauce pairs well with tomato-based sauces

instructions.step: Wash and cut **cherry tomatoes** in half. Toss tomatoes in bowl with **olive oil**, **salt**, and **pepper**. Place tomatoes and **garlic** on a parchment-lined baking sheet flesh side up and in a single layer. Roast in an oven at **450°F** for **25-30 minutes**

context.note: Parchment paper is non-stick. Putting tomatoes flesh side up prevents the tomato skins from burning. Single layer prevents crowding

instructions.step: Season **raw shrimp** with **salt** and a pinch of **baking soda**
instructions.background: Tomatoes and garlic are in the oven

context.note: Use a small amount of baking soda prevents the shrimp from becoming mushy

instructions.background: Tomatoes and garlic are in the oven

instructions.step: Boil **pasta** in **salted** **water** for **1-2 minutes** before instructions for al dente. Set aside pasta and pasta cooking water.
instructions.background: Tomatoes and garlic are in the oven

context.note: Pasta will finish cooking in during the next step

instructions.step: Fry **marinated shrimp** in a pan in high heat for **1 minute** until slightly brown. Remove from heat.

- Remove peel from garlic. Pour roasted tomatoes and garlic into pan. Add **basil** and **red pepper flakes** to sauce mixture. Add **cooked pasta** and some of the **cooked pasta water** to pan and stir on high heat.
  - Remove pan from heat and add most or all of the **grated cheese**.
  - Return pan to heat and add **black pepper** and **olive oil** and stir for another **30 seconds**.
  - Add **salt** to taste. Add more pasta water to adjust consistency.
Add **cooked shrimp** to pasta and toss to combine
Serve pasta with extra **grated cheese** and **extra virgin olive oil**
